titleStmt.title: An act for preventing injuries and wrongs done to merchants at sea, in their persons, ships or goods; and prohibiting mariners from serving under forraign princes or states without license. Die Sabbathi, 13⁰ Aprilis, 1650. Ordered by the Parliament, that this Act be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Scobell, Cleric. Parliamenti.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Edward Husband and Iohn Field, printers to the Parliament of England,

notesStmt.note: Signatures: 7E⁴. Also issued as part of a through-paged set with a table for the entire set added.
On 7E2r: last word of first line of text: "late"; first word of line below initial: "Forraign"; last word of last full line: "time".
Ornament on t.p.; initial letter; some text in black letter.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
